title: Dailyscript
author: Dailyscript
content: Greetings everyone, gor those perspns using kuda microfibance bank. I recieved an email and notification from kuds that we shpuld be aware of social media scams. I know some persons might me aware by not but for those who do mot have the information. I said i should share it here so that we can stay safe using our mobile bnking app. Cant find the screenshot i did. But others can attest to it.

comments.author: DPHOR
comments.body: Social scam isn't a new thing and any body using any mobile app should know how to secure their apps include this kuda app as well, security is what we should take serious unlike other things we do and we don't care about what outcome would be.

comments.author: Justbillywitt
comments.body: Even without the warning from Kuda everyone have to be careful on how they do things mostly this end of year, as there are so much scam going on. So people take the slight opportunity by spreading fake news and links just to fraud people, but it is our primary responsibility to keep ourselves safe from these scammer. By being a member of this forum, we should be able to detect scam whenever we see one, because on a daily basis we are always coming across posts that talks about scams and how to escape them. Don't just keep the knowledge you get from here to yourself, teach your love ones how to be safe from these cheap scammers, because if they get hurt you are indirectly affected.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on December 13, 2023, 05:26:37 PMSocial scam isn't a new thing and any body using any mobile app should know how to secure their apps include this kuda app as well, security is what we should take serious unlike other things we do and we don't care about what outcome would be.You are right that social media scam and scam generally are not something new. Scammers are always everywhere with the high rate of unemployment and underemployment in the country. It is we that should know how to avoid scam. But if someone bring up anything about scam in a way to let people to be aware of some scam and how to avoid them, it is good.Still no matter how you bring up something like this, there are still people that are still scammed, likely because no one to let them know about such scam.Many times, humans are greedy and foolish. They will trust someone that they did not know, or someone they have not seen before and not knowing anyone that knows them. If we do not use our brain the way we can avoid scam, anyone can scam us at anytime.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Dailyscript on December 13, 2023, 05:23:20 PMGreetings everyone, gor those perspns using kuda microfibance bank. I said i should share it here so that we can stay safe using our mobile bnking app. Cant find the screenshot i did. But others can attest to it.Definitely, as we approach the Christmas period like this, it has always been a target period whereby scammers lure people into their targeted good-to-be-true kind of scams, of which if you are not security conscious enough, you are likely to fall victim. So this recent update given by Kuda Microfinance bank na really better one, as it will now put many people on alert on the possible best way to avoid all this kind yeye hungry man scam wey full everywhere for we Naija. But if in case you happen to know any one who fall victim to any of Kuda scam, please don't hesitate to report it to Kuda customer care, as they, Opay and Moniepoint microfinance bank has one of the best non-physical bank customer support team who handles issue professionally.
